commentary_on_process:
I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. To solve the problem, I first determined the year when the Institutional Revolutionary Party first took power, which was 1929. Then, I found the year when the party changed its name to the Institutional Revolutionary Party for the second time, which was 2012. Finally, I subtracted the two years to get the number of years that passed between the two events, which is 83.

To solve the problem better, I could have double-checked my calculations to ensure accuracy. Additionally, I could have used a calculator to avoid any errors in subtraction.
problem_text:
Context:
The PRI, or Institutional Revolutionary Party is one of the major lasting legacies of the Mexican Revolution; its first iteration was the Partido Nacional Revolucionario founded in 1929 under Northern revolutionary general and president of Mexico  Plutarco Elías Calles, following the assassination of president-elect  Álvaro Obregón in 1928. The establishment of the party created an enduring structure that managed not only presidential succession but also groups with competing interests. Initially, Calles remained the power behind the presidency during a period known as the Maximato, but his hand-picked presidential candidate, Lázaro Cárdenas, won a power struggle with Calles, expelling him from the country. Cárdenas reorganized the party that Calles founded, creating formal sectors for interest groups, including one for the Mexican military. The reorganized party was named Party of the Mexican Revolution.  In 1946, the party again changed its name to the Institutional Revolutionary Party. The party under its various names held the presidency from 1929 to 2000 and since 2012, is the party again in power.

Question:
How many years passed between when the Institutional Revolutionary Party in took power the first time and the second time?
question_alone: How many years passed between when the Institutional Revolutionary Party in took power the first time and the second time?

1. Determine the year when the Institutional Revolutionary Party first took power.
2. Determine the year when the party changed its name to the Party of the Mexican Revolution.
3. Determine the year when the party changed its name to the Institutional Revolutionary Party for the second time.
4. Calculate the number of years between the first time the party took power and the second time it took power.
